definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: :Ju Jdg 16:7 cord (prop. as hanging over or down; Aram. [[יַתְרָא]] part of the intestines, Targum [[יְתָרַיׇּא]] ropes, yatro0 cord, rope, chord of arc; Ar. watara bow-string, lute-string; Eth. watr: sinew, cord; watara: stretch bowstring, strain (eyes), be intent, eager, etc.)—[[יֶתֶָר]] Ps 11:2 + 3 t.; sf. [[יִתְרוֹ]] Kt Job 30:11 ([[יִתְרִי]] Qr); [[יִתְרָם]] Job 4:21; —cord, for binding a man Ju Jdg 16:7, Jdg 16:8, Jdg 16:9; bowstring Ps 11:2, Job 30:11 (acc. to Qr, opp. Job 29:20 b; Kt = his cord, with which he reins in my assailants; cf. Di Da). Job 4:21 tent-cord Ew De Di RV; yet rd. perh. [[יְתֵדָם]] their tent-peg, so Ol Hi Sgfr ( > AV their excellency, fr. I. [[יֶתֶר]]).
